author: dan boardman
subject: Re: Rupan on DVD?!
body:
thanks alot between my frriends and i have all those exsept "one dollor 
money wars" i can't wait to get my hands on a copy "castle of cagliostro i 
thought came before "lupins greastest capes" though thanks for the fast 
reply and by the way how maney lupin cds r there i mean god damn theres 
alot. about the t.v. shows i didn't realise so maney were out there to get. 
I do have a fair share(not by no means most by this news) but as you say the 
t.v. colection is huge and is all most imposible to get the hole thing. 
thanks agian

>From: Arsene Lupin III <talesofthewolf@yahoo.com>
>Reply-To: lupin AT mcs DOT kent DOT edu
>To: lupin AT mcs DOT kent DOT edu
>Subject: Re: [lupin] Rupan on DVD?!
>Date: Tue, 26 Sep 2000 15:32:25 -0700 (PDT)
>
> > word whats the latest lupin realease i have most of
> > the t.v. show but if you
> > have any copys that you don't want let me know i'll
> > buy em
>
>The latest commercial American Lupin release is
>"Castle of Cagliostro". Next in line are "Fuma
>Conspiracy" and "Golden Legend of Babylon" (DVD)
>
>The latest Japanese Lupin release is the "One Dollar
>Money Wars" 2000 TV special (a snippet about it was
>covered in the latest Animerica, as well as a review
>of the Cagliostro DVD).
>
>The lastest English fansubtitled release has been
>"Fujiko's Unlucky Days", although Lupin Gang Anime is
>still finishing up the script for their version.
>
>What do you mean by "most of the TV series"? In order
>for you to have "most of it", you would need about 125
>or so episodes (the Lupin TV series 1-3 went into well
>over 200 total episodes). If you have that many, I'm
>sure many fans would be interested in your proposal.
>However, if you had that many, they must certainly not
>be ALL subtitled in English (nobody has gone through
>that much effort to subtitle Lupin TV). If they're raw
>Japanese, though, I'm still interested. Drop me a line
>sometime.
>
>
>=====
>"Arsene Lupin III"
>webmaster@lupinthethird.nospam.com
>(Remove "nospam" to reply)
>http://www.LupintheThird.com
